intro: Schefflera nervosa, commonly known as the Veinleaf Schefflera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Schefflera nervosa thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade.
